bug.author: Createdd
bug.summary: Latest release is not outputing correlations?
bug.description:
The html report does not show correlations or interactions. To Reproduce Example from docs: <denchmark-code>df = pd.DataFrame( np.random.rand(100, 5), columns=['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e'] )
profile = ProfileReport(df, title='Pandas Profiling Report', html={ 'style': {'full_width': True}}) profile </denchmark-code>
Output of the progresss bar is the following: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22077628/77051611-d6b9cd80-69cb-11ea-8d26-a182fd82e9f5.png></denchmark-link>
Version information: Additional context EDIT: There was an error on a previous calculation that disabled the proper calculation for the rest of the notebook. After restarting the notebook the following additional warning message appeared: <denchmark-code>.../python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/model/correlations.py:135: UserWarning: There was an attempt to calculate the cramers correlation, but this failed. To hide this warning, disable the calculation (using `df.profile_report(correlations={"cramers": {"calculate": False}})` If this is problematic for your use case, please report this as an issue: https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues (include the error message: 'No data; `observed` has size 0.') correlation_name=correlation_name, error=error </denchmark-code>
This warning occured with the calculation of the more complex dataset though.
